intro: Thiollierea pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it an attractive addition to xeriscaped landscapes.
